intro: Biscutella varia var. foliosa, commonly known as the leafy biscutella, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and alternate leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in racemes, and it produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds. This species is notable for its ability to thrive in rocky and arid environments, making it a hardy and resilient plant.
